2. Where We Belong (2012)
   This drama movie tells the story of a downtown street hustler named Drone who leads an disobedient group of young men engaging in juvenile delinquency and violence that was left behind by their guardian Chief.

Drone as a new leader makes different encounters to find money for survival where he got arrested.

His set free with the help an uptown girl Julian whom they later develop affection.

As time passes, he decides to drop the drug business aside for good and focus living a positive life as boxer.

The film follows the lives of two high school students named Holden Caulfield and Sarah Conley.
Holden Caulfield is a misanthropic and often depressed teenager who has recently lost his best friend, Phoebe Caulfield.
Sarah Conley is a more optimistic and less depressed teenage girl who has recently lost her best friend, Phoebe Caulfield.
The film follows the lives of Holden Caulfield and Sarah Conley as they navigate through their high school years and try to find their place in the world.

Based on the given preferences and keywords, here are some recommendations:

1. Titanic (1997) ) - This classic romance film by James Cameron tells a story about a young aristocrat who falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.
2. Hitch (2005) ) - This comedic thriller film directed by David Fincher is based on the novel Hitchiker's Guide to the Galaxy by Douglas Adams.
3. "Smilla' s Sense of Snow" (1997) ) - This family drama film directed by Thomas Vinterberg features a young Inuit woman who discovers that she has lost contact with her mother who lives in Greenland.
4. "Find Me Guilty" (2006) ) - This legal thriller film directed by Richard Portnow is based on the non-fiction book Find Me Guilty: A Journey into the Lives of Convicts and Their Families by David Mullaney, Richard Portnow, and Michael Cullen.
Overall, these movies offer a variety of themes, styles, and approaches to storytelling. Whether you are looking for something exciting and action-packed, or something more contemplative and introspective, one or more of these movies might be just what you are looking for.

I would recommend "The Godfather" directed by Francis Ford Coppola and released in 1972.

The film tells the story of the Corleone crime family, based on Mario Puzo's novel "The Godfather."

Starring Marlon Brando as Don Vito Corleone, Al Pacino as Michael Corleone, James Caan as Tom Hagen, and Robert Duvall as Giorgio Murat (The Godfather Part II)), the film received critical acclaim upon its release in 1972.

The Godfather won four Academy Awards: Best Picture, Best Director, Best Adapted Screenplay.

The Godfather is often regarded as one of the greatest movies ever made.
